Type.Name: ArgIterator
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Docs.summary: This class is used to acess variable arguments on methods that use the __arglist calling convention.

Docs.param: The handle to the argument list, as obtained by the special compiler __arglist expression.
Docs.summary: Creates an ArgIterator from a RuntimeArgumentHandle.

Docs.param: The argument list, as obtained by the special compiler keyword __arglist.
Overrides the starting address for computing parameters.
Docs.summary: Initialize an ArgIterator using a base address.

Docs.remarks: Invalidates the ArgIterator instance, from this point on operations will throw an exception.

Docs.returns: Returns the next argument as a .
Docs.remarks: This advances the position of the argument iterator.

Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'RuntimeTypeHandle'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'TypedReference'

Docs.summary: Returns the type of the next argument.
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'RuntimeTypeHandle'
Docs.remarks: This does not advance the current position in the iterator.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of remaining arguments to be processed.
Docs.returns: The count of arguments remaining to be processed.
